poem:
### The Year We Were Warmed

Beneath a hot sky,  
troubled fires dance,  
casting shadows on empty streets—  
curfews whispered  
through the anxious dark.  
How quiet the world  
when the heat takes hold,  
leaving us to wonder  
if mourning flames  
are all that's left  
to light our way.
